alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 01 at 2:31AM MDT until April 02 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS AS WELL AS THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT LATE SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS AS WELL AS THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Areas of critical fire weather conditions are expected over much of the northeast Highlands and Plains of New Mexico for this afternoon due to the combination of strong winds and low humidity. The Red Flag Warning remains in effect for these areas through this evening. Critical fire weather conditions look to expand over more of eastern New Mexico for Sunday and a Fire Weather Watch remains in effect for Sunday. Temperatures are expected to be higher on Sunday with several hours of single digit relative humidity levels in the afternoon along with strong westerly winds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Northeast Plains (Zone 104) and Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) until 8 PM today, again Saturday afternoon through early evening, and again late Sunday morning through early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph on Saturday afternoon. West winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph Sunday afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values dropping to between 8 to 12 percent this afternoon and Sunday afternoon when there will be 5 to 8 hours of single digit relative humidly. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
